page.title: 09THE HOVERPORT, PEGWELL
page.content: The hoverport was built in 1967 but the first S.R.N.6 hovercraft did not carry cars. In summer there were two hovercrafts which went to Calais. Pegwell Bay was an ideal site as it was protected on three sides, is flat and has a good access road.It takes 30 minutes to cross the channel on a calm sea and about an hour in a rough sea. In one year it costs Â£2,000000 to operate one craft and the cost of one craft is Â£250,000. The pilot has to be between 26 and 40 years old. The S.R.N.4 mk 2 carries 227 people + 34 cars. The S.R.N.4 mk 3 carries 424 people + 55 cars. The hoverport is now only a servicing depot because Hoverlloyd sold out to B.R. (Seaspeed) at Dover. It would be difficult to see the port in operation again now that Port Sally at Ramsgate Harbour is being developed.
